thread.title: U.S. Dollar Gains, Lifted by Rising Yields

author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Gains, Lifted by Rising Yields
text:
The U.S. dollar rose Tuesday as signs that central banks around the world are pulling away from stimulative policies helped lift bond yields.
The Wall Street Journal Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, rose 0.2% to 86.05. The dollar gained against the euro and the Swiss franc, while declining against the yen.
